pageContext.claim: “And the Vice Premier said when I said, 'Give us a token of affection.' He said, 'We will immediately by 10 million tons of soybeans.' And I looked at Sonny Perdue, who's doing a fantastic job, as you know, Secretary of Agriculture -- I said, 'Sonny, is 10 million tons of soybeans a lot? It sounds -- ' He said, 'That's a lot.' And they started buying 10 million.”
pageContext.analysis: China agreed to make a one-time purchase of 10 million tons of soybeans. But this is relatively small given that China used to buy 30 to 35 million tons of soybeans a year before Trump launched his trade war. The proposed Chinese purchase amounts to 7.2 percent of the total U.S. production.
